title: Nasheed, Kananathan meet Kenyan President at AU Summit
byline: A high-level bilateral meeting aimed at advancing climate action and sustainable development was held on the sidelines of the 39th African Union Summit.

title: What Australia Needs to Do to Avoid Elimination from the T20 World Cup 2026
byline: Australia’s T20 World Cup 2026 campaign is suddenly under pressure after their shock defeat to Zimbabwe in Group B. With Sri Lanka, Zimbabwe, Australia, and Ireland all still in contention for the Super Eights, the qualification race has become one of the tightest in the tournament. Here’s what Australia must do to avoid elimination and keep their T20 World Cup hopes alive.

title: ’Fast-spreading’ measles outbreak hits several schools in London
byline: At least 34 children have been infected by a ’’fast-spreading’’ measles outbreak in several north London schools, health officials have said.

title: Over 400,500 tourists arrive in first two months of 2026
byline: A total of 401,787 tourists have arrived in the country during the first two months of this year, according to the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA).

title: Lawyers’ islandwide strike forces postponement of ’Krrish’ case
byline: The Colombo High Court today ordered that the case filed against Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa over the ‘Krrish’ transaction be postponed till February 19.

title: Three nabbed with ‘Kush’ cannabis worth Rs. 160 mn
byline: Three individuals, including a woman, were arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) by officers of the Airport Police Narcotics Division in Wellampitiya for allegedly possessing more than 16 kilograms of ‘Kush’ cannabis.

title: Health Ministry removes condom awareness post after online backlash
byline: The Health Ministry has removed a social media post promoting condom use after it sparked controversy and criticism online.

title: O/L candidates told to check updated timetable
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations has urged candidates sitting for the 2025 G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) Examination to carefully follow the official examination timetable, as the exam is set to commence tomorrow (17).

title: Rock rolls down the hill crushing two workers to death
byline: A huge boulder which had rolled down a hill had crushed two workers who were blasting rocks in a quarry about 300ft below at Mapitiya in Bandarawela on Saturday (14). Their bodies were recovered by the police with the help of the army.

title: Power tariff hikes are temporary : Deputy Minister
byline: Government to implement a long term plan for reducing electricity tariffs over a three year period as promised.

title: GMOA halts submitting vital data to Health Ministry, threatening national healthcare sector
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to further intensify its ongoing trade union action, a move that is increasingly disrupting public healthcare services and posing a threat to the national health system while inconveniencing patients.

title: Motorbike raids on villages kill dozens in Nigeria
byline: Gunmen on motorcycles have killed dozens of people in dawn raids across three villages in north-western Nigeria.

title: Leading miller to take wings to U.S. for private helicopter purchase
byline: Reaffirming his plan for investment in the aviation business, Sri Lanka’s leading mill owner Mithrapala Lankeshwara said that he would fly to the United States tomorrow to finalise the purchase of yet another aircraft for commercial purposes in Sri Lanka.

title: Pakistan Coach says dressing room hurting after India capitulation
byline: Head coach Mike Hesson admitted Pakistan’s players were hurting in the dressing room after their crushing 61-run defeat to arch-rivals India in Colombo on Sunday.

title: Strict plastic ban to be enforced at Sri Pada
byline: Strict regulations will be enforced under the ‘Samanola Siri – Haritha Wandana’ national mission to safeguard the fragile ecosystem of Sri Pada from the harmful impact of plastic and polythene, Additional Secretary to the President (Clean Sri Lanka Project) S.P.C. Sugeeshwara said.

title: UK Deputy Prime Minister visits Sri Lanka to strengthen UK Sri Lanka partnership
byline: UK Deputy Prime Minister David Lammy will visit Sri Lanka on Tuesday 17 February to reaffirm the UK–Sri Lanka partnership and witness the UK’s humanitarian response to Cyclone Ditwah.

title: New minimum paddy purchase prices announced
byline: The government has announced the minimum prices at which the Paddy Marketing Board (PMB) will purchase paddy from farmers for the 2025/2026 Maha season.

title: Namal slams govt for failing to take responsibility
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna National Organizer and Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa said, today criticised the government, accusing it of failing to take responsibility despite being in power for more than a year and a half.

title: UNP tells Public Security Minister to resign
byline: The United National Party (UNP), which held Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala responsible for the deterioration of law and order, called for his resignation today.

title: Breakdown of family life is alarming: Cardinal
byline: The breakdown of families in Sri Lanka is becoming an alarming situation in Sri Lanka, just like the rest of the world, Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith said.

title: Cricket fans arrive in 15 private jets for India–Pakistan World T20 clash
byline: A large number of international cricket fans arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport in Katunayake aboard 15 special private jets to witness the high-profile India-Pakistan encounter of the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup held in Colombo on February 15.

title: Smith officially added to Australia T20 World Cup squad
byline: Steven Smith has been officially added to Australia’s T20 World Cup squad, filling the spot created by Josh Hazlewood’s absence, meaning he is available to face Sri Lanka on Monday evening if needed.

title: Special arrangements in place for G.C.E. (O/L) examination 2025 (2026)
byline: Comprehensive security and special arrangements have been put in place for the General Certificate of Education (Ordinary Level) Examination 2025 (2026), which will be held from February 17 to 26, the Department of Examinations Sri Lanka announced.
